NO2 Recommendations: Unusually sensitive individuals should consider limiting prolonged exertion especially near busy roads.
PM10 Recommendations: Unusually sensitive people should consider reducing prolonged or heavy exertion.
PM2.5 Recommendations: Unusually sensitive people should consider reducing prolonged or heavy exertion.
O3 Recommendations: Unusually sensitive people should consider reducing prolonged or heavy outdoor exertion.

SO2 Recommendations: People with asthma should consider limiting outdoor exertion.
NO2 Recommendations: People with asthma, children and older adults should limit prolonged exertion especially near busy roads.
PM10 Recommendations: People with heart or lung disease, older adults, children, and people of lower socioeconomic status should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion.
PM2.5 Recommendations: People with heart or lung disease, older adults, children, and people of lower socioeconomic status should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion.
O3 Recommendations: People with lung disease (such as asthma), children, older adults, people who are active outdoors (including outdoor workers), people with certain genetic variants, and people with diets limited in certain nutrients should reduce prolonged or heavy outdoor exertion.
CO Recommendations: People with heart disease, such as angina, should limit heavy exertion and avoid sources of CO, such as heavy traffic.

SO2 Recommendations: Children, people with asthma, or other lung diseases, should limit outdoor exertion.
NO2 Recommendations: People with asthma, children and older adults should avoid prolonged exertion near roadways; everyone else should limit prolonged exertion especially near busy roads.
PM10 Recommendations: People with heart or lung disease, older adults, children, and people of lower socioeconomic status should avoid prolonged or heavy exertion; everyone else should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion.
PM2.5 Recommendations: People with heart or lung disease, older adults, children, and people of lower socioeconomic status should avoid prolonged or heavy exertion; everyone else should reduce prolonged or heavy exertion.
O3 Recommendations: People with lung disease (such as asthma), children, older adults, people who are active outdoors (including outdoor workers), people with certain genetic variants, and people with diets limited in certain nutrients should avoid prolonged or heavy outdoor exertion; everyone else should reduce prolonged or heavy outdoor exertion.
CO Recommendations: People with heart disease, such as angina, should limit moderate exertion and avoid sources of CO, such as heavy traffic.

SO2 Recommendations: Children, people with asthma, or other lung diseases should avoid outdoor exertion; everyone else should reduce outdoor exertion.
NO2 Recommendations: People with asthma, children and older adults should avoid all outdoor exertion; everyone else should avoid prolonged exertion especially near busy roads.
PM10 Recommendations: People with heart or lung disease, older adults, children, and people of lower socioeconomic status should avoid all physical activity outdoors. Everyone else should avoid prolonged or heavy exertion.
PM2.5 Recommendations: People with heart or lung disease, older adults, children, and people of lower socioeconomic status should avoid all physical activity outdoors. Everyone else should avoid prolonged or heavy exertion.
O3 Recommendations: People with lung disease (such as asthma), children, older adults, people who are active outdoors (including outdoor workers), people with certain genetic variants, and people with diets limited in certain nutrients should avoid all outdoor exertion; everyone else should reduce outdoor exertion.
CO Recommendations: People with heart disease, such as angina, should avoid exertion and sources of CO, such as heavy traffic.

SO2 Recommendations: Children, people with asthma, or other lung diseases, should remain indoors; everyone else should avoid outdoor exertion.
NO2 Recommendations: People with asthma, children and older adults should remain indoors; everyone else should avoid all outdoor exertion.
PM10 Recommendations: Everyone should avoid all physical activity outdoors; people with heart or lung disease, older adults, children, and people of lower socioeconomic status should remain indoors and keep activity levels low.
PM2.5 Recommendations: Everyone should avoid all physical activity outdoors; people with heart or lung disease, older adults, children, and people of lower socioeconomic status should remain indoors and keep activity levels low.
O3 Recommendations: Everyone should avoid all outdoor exertion
CO Recommendations: People with heart disease, such as angina, should avoid exertion and sources of CO, such as heavy traffic; everyone else should limit heavy exertion.
